description: The Phillies signed Rob Thomson to a two-year contract Monday, naming him the team's full-time manager after he took over for Joe Girardi in June and led the Phillies to the playoffs.
title: Phils name Thomson manager with 2-year deal

description: Cubs president of baseball operations Jed Hoyer returned to the ambiguous concept of "intelligent spending" -- which could price the big-market club out of the massive contracts at the top end of the free agent market.
title: Cubs' Hoyer planning more 'intelligent spending'

description: Pitcher Nick Sandlin will miss the rest of the Cleveland Guardians' postseason after an MRI revealed a strain in his shoulder, which will shut him down for up to six weeks.
title: Guardians P Sandlin out with injured shoulder

description: Joe Musgrove baffled the New York Mets in Game 3 on Sunday night at Citi Field, leading the San Diego Padres to a 6-0 victory, sealing a berth in the NLDS against the Los Angeles Dodgers.
title: Prescient Musgrove, Padres blank Mets in G3 win

description: Here's why your squad could be playing into November -- or be sent home next.
title: Everything you need to know about the eight remaining playoff teams

description: The Atlanta Braves have signed rookie right-hander Spencer Strider to a six-year contract worth $75 million through the 2028 season, the team announced Monday.
title: Braves lock up Strider with 6-year, $75M deal

description: Despite winning 101 games and enjoying 175 days in first place, the Mets' season ended in disappointing fashion with their loss Sunday night to the Padres.
title: 'Worst day of the year': Mets lament early exit

description: David Purdum looks at what's behind the the Bills-Chiefs and Cowboys-Eagles opening lines, and goes over other odds and ends from the weekend in NFL and college football betting.
title: Notable bets: Behind the Bills-Chiefs and Cowboys-Eagles opening lines

description: Collector Matt Allen dropped $474,000 in January on an unproven minor leaguer who had yet to appear in Double-A. Is such big-ticket prospecting the new frontier in the memorabilia market?
title: New York Yankees prospect Jasson Dominguez stars in a bold new world of sports card prospecting
Follow live: Braves begin their quest for a second straight title

description: Phillies reliever David Robertson is not on the division series roster after straining his calf celebrating.
title: Phils' Robertson hurt celebrating, out of NLDS

description: Braves rookie Spencer Strider, who hasn't pitched since Sept. 18, has been added to the team's NLDS roster vs. the Phillies.
title: Braves' Strider makes return for NLDS vs. Phillies

description: The Yankees have left DJ LeMahieu off their ALDS roster as the infielder continues to be bothered by toe inflammation. Matt Carpenter will rejoin the team after breaking his foot in August.
title: LeMahieu off Yanks' ALDS roster; Carpenter back

description: The Astros are going with rookies Hunter Brown and David Hensley for the ALDS vs. Seattle over veteran relievers Will Smith and Phil Maton, who had surgery.
title: Astros' Maton has surgery after punching locker

description: Julio Urias will get the ball for the Dodgers in Game 1 of the NLDS, followed by Clayton Kershaw in Game 2. The Padres will go with Mike Clevinger, then Yu Darvish.
title: Urias to start Game 1 for Dodgers; Kershaw next

description: The San Francisco Giants have hired Houston assistant general manager Pete Putila as their new GM.
title: Giants hire Astros executive Putila to be new GM

description: Explore matchups and follow the action as MLB's division series round goes live.
title: Eight teams kick off the first day of LDS play
